content.raw: One possibility is to cache the results of [Joint::FindAllConnectedLinks](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/5dcc655e9498fcccce8cf92363514c5ea12c4499/gazebo/physics/Joint.cc?at=set_joint_position#cl-1098) when it's called for the first time. But we'll also need a flag that keeps track of when the model is modified, and refreshes the cache.
content.html: One possibility is to cache the results of Joint::FindAllConnectedLinks when it's called for the first time. But we'll also need a flag that keeps track of when the model is modified, and refreshes the cache.

content.raw:
The joint_set_position_test has a lot of console spam. Perhaps we could reduce that a bit?
~~~
[Wrn] [Joint.cc:645] failed to find a clean set of connected links, i.e. this joint is inside a loop, cannot SetPosition kinematically.
[Dbg] [Link.cc:1200] we have a loop! cannot find nice subset of connected links, this link link_2 connects back to parent link_3.
~~~
These two lines are repeated a lot.
content.html:
The joint_set_position_test has a lot of console spam. Perhaps we could reduce that a bit?

[Wrn] [Joint.cc:645] failed to find a clean set of connected links, i.e. this joint is inside a loop, cannot SetPosition kinematically.
[Dbg] [Link.cc:1200] we have a loop! cannot find nice subset of connected links, this link link_2 connects back to parent link_3.

These two lines are repeated a lot.

content.raw: possibly due to [this recursive lock?](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/5a3d917b952f2c19cb512262521edd8c45bcf70a/gazebo/physics/Joint.cc?at=set_joint_position#cl-625).  Although I have not experienced deadlocks while running in linux.
content.html: possibly due to this recursive lock?. Although I have not experienced deadlocks while running in linux.
